intro: Webera oppositifolia, commonly known as the opposite-leaved webera, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its opposite arrangement of lance-shaped leaves and produces small, pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
